data.current_description: Lists platform policies owned by a project in the specified platform. Returns `INVALID_ARGUMENT` if the project or the platform doesn't exist.
data.summary_suggestion: List platform policies for a project
data.description_suggestion: Lists all platform policies owned by a project in the specified platform. Returns a collection of PlatformPolicy objects. Returns `INVALID_ARGUMENT` if the project or the platform doesn't exist. Supports pagination through optional parameters.

data.current_description: Creates a platform policy, and returns a copy of it. Returns `NOT_FOUND` if the project or platform doesn't exist, `INVALID_ARGUMENT` if the request is malformed, `ALREADY_EXISTS` if the policy already exists, and `INVALID_ARGUMENT` if the policy contains a platform-specific policy that does not match the platform value specified in the URL.
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new platform policy for the specified project and platform. Accepts a PlatformPolicy object in the request body and returns the created policy with server-assigned metadata. Returns `NOT_FOUND` if the project or platform doesn't exist, `INVALID_ARGUMENT` if the request is malformed or if the policy's platform-specific configuration doesn't match the URL platform, and `ALREADY_EXISTS` if a policy with the same identifier already exists.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is comprehensive but could clarify that the request body contains a PlatformPolicy object and that the response includes server-assigned metadata. Improved clarity about what constitutes invalid arguments for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description: Gets the access control policy for a resource. Returns an empty policy if the resource exists and does not have a policy set.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve IAM policy for a resource
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the Identity and Access Management (IAM) policy for the specified Binary Authorization resource. data.current_description: Sets the access control policy on the specified resource. Replaces any existing policy. Can return `NOT_FOUND`, `INVALID_ARGUMENT`, and `PERMISSION_DENIED` errors.
data.summary_suggestion: Set IAM policy for a resource
data.description_suggestion: Sets the Identity and Access Management (IAM) policy on the specified Binary Authorization resource, replacing any existing policy. Accepts a SetIamPolicyRequest containing the desired IamPolicy object. Returns the updated IamPolicy object. Returns `NOT_FOUND` if the resource doesn't exist, `INVALID_ARGUMENT` if the policy is malformed, and `PERMISSION_DENIED` if the caller lacks permission to modify the policy.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description lacks input/output details and doesn't specify the request/response schemas. message: Operation 'binaryauthorization.projects.policy.testIamPermissions' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_context. Missing summary. Description lacks clarity about input/output types and their structure. Added explicit mention of TestIamPermissionsRequest input and TestIamPermissionsResponse output, clarified the purpose (permission checking for UIs/tools), and emphasized the non-authoritative nature of this operation for AI agent understanding of appropriate use cases.

data.current_description: Returns permissions that a caller has on the specified resource. If the resource does not exist, this will return an empty set of permissions, not a `NOT_FOUND` error. Note: This operation is designed to be used for building permission-aware UIs and command-line tools, not for authorization checking. This operation may "fail open" without warning.
data.summary_suggestion: Test IAM permissions on a resource
data.description_suggestion: Tests which Identity and Access Management (IAM) permissions the authenticated caller has on the specified Binary Authorization resource. Accepts a TestIamPermissionsRequest containing a list of permissions to check. Returns a TestIamPermissionsResponse with the subset of requested permissions that the caller possesses. If the resource does not exist, returns an empty permission set rather than a `NOT_FOUND` error. Designed for building permission-aware UIs and tools, not for authorization enforcement. May fail open without warning.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description lacks clarity about input/output types and their structure. Added explicit mention of TestIamPermissionsRequest input and TestIamPermissionsResponse output, clarified the purpose (permission checking for UIs/tools), and emphasized the non-authoritative nature of this operation for AI agent understanding of appropriate use cases.

data.current_description: Returns whether the given `Attestation` for the given image URI was signed by the given `Attestor`
data.description_suggestion: Validates whether the provided attestation for a given image URI was cryptographically signed by the specified attestor. This operation verifies the authenticity and integrity of container image attestations. Requires the attestor resource name and a ValidateAttestationOccurrenceRequest containing the attestation and image URI. Returns a ValidateAttestationOccurrenceResponse indicating whether the attestation is valid and signed by the attestor.

data.current_description: Evaluates a Kubernetes object versus a GKE platform policy. Returns `NOT_FOUND` if the policy doesn't exist, `INVALID_ARGUMENT` if the policy or request is malformed and `PERMISSION_DENIED` if the client does not have sufficient permissions.
data.summary_suggestion: Evaluate Kubernetes object against GKE policy
data.description_suggestion: Evaluates whether a Kubernetes object complies with the specified GKE platform policy. This operation performs policy-based validation to determine if the object meets Binary Authorization requirements for GKE deployments. Requires the policy resource name and an EvaluateGkePolicyRequest containing the Kubernetes object to evaluate. Returns an EvaluateGkePolicyResponse with the evaluation result and any policy violations. Returns `NOT_FOUND` if the policy doesn't exist, `INVALID_ARGUMENT` if the policy or request is malformed, and `PERMISSION_DENIED` if the client lacks sufficient permissions.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description covers error cases but lacks clarity about what the operation returns on success, what inputs are expected, and the purpose of evaluation in the Binary Authorization context. data.description_suggestion: Lists all attestors in the specified project. Retrieves a collection of attestor resources that can be used for image attestation validation in Binary Authorization policies. Requires the project resource name. Returns a ListAttestorsResponse containing the attestors and pagination information. Returns `INVALID_ARGUMENT` if the project does not exist. Supports pagination through page size and page token parameters.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is minimal and doesn't explain what is returned or mention pagination support. Added clarity about the return value structure, pagination capabilities, and the role of attestors in the Binary Authorization system for better AI agent understanding of list operation semantics.

message: Operation 'binaryauthorization.projects.attestors.create' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context. Missing summary. Description lacks context about what an attestor is and its role in Binary Authorization, making it difficult for AI agents to understand when to use this operation. Added domain context explaining attestor purpose, clarified the required inputs and their structure, and maintained comprehensive error documentation.

data.current_description: Creates an attestor, and returns a copy of the new attestor. Returns `NOT_FOUND` if the project does not exist, `INVALID_ARGUMENT` if the request is malformed, `ALREADY_EXISTS` if the attestor already exists.
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new attestor resource in the specified project. An attestor is used to validate container image attestations in Binary Authorization policies. Requires the project resource name and an Attestor object with the attestor configuration including public keys or user-managed identities. Returns the newly created Attestor resource. Returns `NOT_FOUND` if the project does not exist, `INVALID_ARGUMENT` if the request is malformed, and `ALREADY_EXISTS` if an attestor with the same name already exists.
